intro: Argostemma victorianum, commonly known as the Victorian argostemma, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly rough texture. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
